Fund for Adult Education
914 EAST GREEN STREET
PASADENA I, CALIFORNIA
December 19, 1952
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Treasurer
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Frank:
My absence from the office for several days has delayed
this reply to your letter of December 11.
You raise the question as to whether the expense stateÂ¬
ment presents any points of awkwardness. Technically, I
suppose, Thorton and Hunt were guests of the NAEB rather
than the Fund. However, since the expenditures for them
have been lumped in the totals, I think the only practical
thing to do is for us to underwrite this item, as well as
the expenses of the invited representatives of NAEB.
In short, I shall simply put the statement through as is,
for payment and the check should be on its way shortly.
We too, felt that the Chicago meeting had been helpful
all around and I am sure that within the vast dimensions
of the total job to be done, it will be possible to sharpen
up progressively the appropriate divisions of labor as
among the various organizations and agencies concerned.
My very best.
Sincerely yours.
G. H. Griffiths
